intro: Sinningia lateritia, commonly known as the rock violet, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, which bloom during the cooler months. Sinningia lateritia is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is well adapted to high-altitude environments. Its unique morphology and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine collections.
